    • Method Detail

      • changeWorld

        public void changeWorld(java.lang.String newWorldName,
                        float playerSpawnX,
                        float playerSpawnY)
        Loads a new world file for the player to explore.
        Parameters:
        newWorldName - The name of the new world.
        playerSpawnX - The player's starting x coordinate.
        playerSpawnY - The player's starting y coordinate.

      • display

        public void display(java.lang.String message)
        Passes on the given message to the view to be displayed and visible to the user.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to show.

      • dropCurrentlySelectedStack

        public void dropCurrentlySelectedStack()
        "Drops" all items in the currently selected inventory slot (if any) by taking the entire stack without putting it anywhere. The user can't get these items back.

      • enterCombatMode

        public void enterCombatMode(Mob opponent)
        Initializes combat with the specified opponent, stopping the world's regular updates.
        Parameters:
        opponent - The mob that the player will fight against.

      • exitCombatMode

        public void exitCombatMode()
        Ends the combat for the world to continue updating.

      • gainXP

        public void gainXP(java.lang.String skillName,
                   int XP)
        Processes XP gain for the player. If the player levels up on a skill, the stats are updated if applicable, and the stats panel is updated. The skills table is always updated to reflect new level progress.
        Parameters:
        skillName - The name of the skill to gain XP for.
        XP - The amount of experience points gained.

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver()
        Ends the game, deleting the user's player file.

      • getCamera

        public Camera getCamera()

      • getCurrentlySelectedItem

        public Item getCurrentlySelectedItem()

      • getCurrentWorld

        public World getCurrentWorld()

      • getInstance

        public static Game getInstance()

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()

      • getState

        public DrawableWorld getState()

      • init

        public void init(java.lang.String playerFilePath,
                 java.lang.String worldName,
                 GameCreationMode loadOrCreatePlayer)
        Initializes all the resources required to run the game. By the time this method is run, the Game singleton has been properly instanced so other parts of the game can refer to it.
        Parameters:
        playerFilePath - The path of the player file to load from the file system.
        worldName - The name of the world to load from the file system.
        loadOrCreatePlayer - Whether the game should create or load a player with the given name.

      • isInCombatMode

        public boolean isInCombatMode()

      • killEntity

        public void killEntity(Entity e)
        Marks an entity to be removed from the game after the next logic cycle.
        Parameters:
        e - The entity to remove from the game.

      • movePlayer

        private void movePlayer(int pressedKeyCode)
        Attempts to make the player move and moves the Camera as well if the player could move. Also updates the game state if the player changed tiles.
        Parameters:
        pressedKeyCode - The code of the keyboard key the user pressed in an attempt to move.

      • putInPlayerInventory

        public boolean putInPlayerInventory(Item item,
                                    int quantity)
        Attempts to put the specified amount of the specified item into the player's inventory and updates the inventory table if needed.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to attempt to add.
        quantity - The amount of items of the same kind to add.
        Returns:
        true if the item was successfully added to the inventory, or false if not.

      • respondToKeyboardInput

        public void respondToKeyboardInput(int pressedKeyCode)
        Takes the appropriate action based on user input and the game's state.
        Parameters:
        pressedKeyCode - The code of the keyboard key the user pressed.

      • run

        public void run()
        Begins the busy update cycle of the game. Will continue until told to stop by an action within the game.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • setSelectedItem

        public void setSelectedItem(java.lang.String itemName)
        Sets the currently selected item.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the item to set as currently selected.

      • spawn

        public void spawn(Entity newEntity)
        Marks a new entity to be spawned between update cycles of the world.
        Parameters:
        newEntity - The entity to add to the world.

      • stopAndExit

        public void stopAndExit()

      • takeFromPlayerInventory

        public Item takeFromPlayerInventory(java.lang.String itemName,
                                    int quantity)
        Attempts to take the specified amount of the specified item from the player's inventory and updated the inventory table if needed.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the item to take.
        quantity - The amount of items of the same kind to take.
        Returns:
        An instance of the item(s) taken, if successfully taken, or null if they couldn't be taken.

      • update

        private void update()
        Updates the world if the game is not in combat mode, or updates the combat if in combat mode.

      • updateAllViewElements

        public void updateAllViewElements()

      • updateEquipmentPanel

        public void updateEquipmentPanel()

      • updateInventoryTable

        public void updateInventoryTable()

      • updateSkillsTable

        public void updateSkillsTable()

      • updateStatsPanel

        public void updateStatsPanel()

      • useSelectedItem

        private boolean useSelectedItem()
        Makes the currently selected Item be used by the player.
        Returns:
        true if the item could be used, or false if not
